DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Sum Target Lesion Present Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response used to determine the final aggregate number of tumors composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues that are the primary target of the therapeutic intervention.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Sum Target Lesion Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._The final aggregate amount._An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination._A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: The final aggregate amount.:An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.:A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The quantity of the specified item.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: Determining the number or amount of something.
